Name: Statuette of Osiris standing
Description: This statuette of bronze represents the god Osiris standing. His body is entirely enveloped in a shroud, which allows the hands to be free . He wears the atef-crown, provided with a uraeus at the front and at the back with a ribbon which continues at the top of the shroud. The ornament is composed of a middle part, which resembles the white crown of Upper Egypt surmounted by a solar disk, a pair of rams horns and two ostrich feathers; the whole is flanked by two uraeus also wearing solar disks.
